definition: to set off/to start (on a journey)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: They started out early so that they would not miss the train.
sentences.chinese: 他们早早出发是为了不误火车。

sentences.english: They were waiting for the day to dawn.
Depart to Pena palace at the top of Sintra mountain.
sentences.chinese: 出发前往辛特拉佩纳宫山的顶部。

sentences.english: From which platform does the train start?
sentences.chinese: 这列火车从哪一个站台出发？

sentences.english: It was still pitch-dark when I started off from Delamu Inn.
sentences.chinese: 早上从德拉姆客栈出发时，四周还是漆黑一团。
这些人排成一列排队一声不吭地出发了。

sentences.english: When I finished counting the men I had left.
sentences.chinese: 待我清点完人数我就得出发。

sentences.english: A lot of expeditions stock up on that before they go.
sentences.chinese: 不少远征团出发前，都备好大量肯达尔薄荷饼。

sentences.english: In the spring of 480 Xerxes set out from Sardis.
sentences.chinese: 在公元前480年春，薜西斯从萨迪斯出发。

sentences.english: They set off on a fine morning.
sentences.chinese: 他们在一个大晴天的早上出发。

sentences.english: The car must break down just when we were about to start off.
sentences.chinese: 我们正要出发时偏偏车又坏了。

sentences.english: A giant mulish horse team saved city of sweet day heart to set out from Qinghai.
sentences.chinese: 一支庞大的骡马队伍从青海省香日德城出发了。

sentences.english: We left the hustle and bustle of the city behind us and departed for the beach.
sentences.chinese: 我们将都市的熙攘抛在脑后，出发前往海边。

sentences.english: At 10.30 pm we'll depart for our first night of aurora viewing.
sentences.chinese: 晚上10点半出发，开始第1个极光观赏之夜。

sentences.english: He was repaid for his conscientious anxiety in the character of a spectator.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个旁观者，他那从良心出发的焦虑得到了补偿。

sentences.english: The voyage lasted 46 minutes, from its departure in Philadephia to its landing across the Delaware River.
sentences.chinese: 从费城出发抵达特拉华河对面的旅程持续了46分钟。

definition: to set out on a journey
(of a bus, train etc) to leave for/heading for

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
to ride as a passenger/to travel by (car, plane etc)
to leave for/to proceed towards/to go
to ride (in a car or carriage)/to drive/to motor
